parametrized_description: A clinic administers two types of vaccines, Pill and Shot. Administering a Pill vaccine takes TimePerPill minutes, while administering a Shot vaccine takes TimePerShot minutes. The clinic must administer at least ShotToPillRatio times as many Shots as Pills, and at least MinPills Pills. Given that the clinic operates for TotalOperatingTime minutes, the goal is to maximize the number of patients vaccinated.

TimePerPill.description: Time required to administer a pill vaccine

TimePerShot.description: Time required to administer a shot vaccine

ShotToPillRatio.description: Minimum ratio of shots to pills

MinPills.description: Minimum number of pill vaccines to administer

TotalOperatingTime.description: Total operating time of the clinic in minutes

NumberOfPills.description: The number of pill vaccines to administer

NumberOfShots.description: The number of shot vaccines to administer

constraints.description: The total time required to administer Pill vaccines and Shot vaccines must not exceed TotalOperatingTime minutes.
The number of Shot vaccines administered must be at least ShotToPillRatio times the number of Pill vaccines administered.
At least MinPills Pill vaccines must be administered.

objective.description: Maximize the total number of patients vaccinated, which is the sum of Pill and Shot vaccines administered.
